core_constraints.name: cat_stops_at_first_liked_plant
core_constraints.description: Each cat walks from pot 1 to m and stops at the first pot containing a plant it likes.

core_constraints.name: plant_assignment_is_permutation
core_constraints.description: Each pot must contain exactly one distinct plant (i.e., plants form a permutation of 1..m).

core_constraints.name: cat_target_pot_must_match_stop_position
core_constraints.description: For each cat, the pot where it stops (first liked plant in ordering) must equal its given target pot p.

core_constraints.name: global_sum_limits
core_constraints.description: Across test cases: sum(n) ≤ 2e5, sum(m) ≤ 2e5, sum(k) ≤ 5e5 (assumed from input note).

objective.description: Determine whether there exists a permutation of plants in pots such that every cat stops at its assigned target pot.

invariant.name: greedy_assignment_with_ordering_constraint
invariant.description: The assignment of plants to pots must respect the left-to-right stopping behavior of cats; this induces precedence constraints among plant positions.
